page.title: 03Ecology (Pollution)
page.content:
Pollution
Generally, the area suffers very little from pollution. There are, however, potential sources of river pollution. The main one is silage effluent. This is controlled fairly well; although the river here is not entirely free from it, little, if any, enters the river in the area itself. A smaller source of agricultural pollution are nitrates, used on a small scale on the valley floor, where a little barley is grown. There is no problem caused by sewage effluent as this goes to a sewage treatment works, which returns pure water to the River Esk. The main tributary in the area is Iburndale Beck, which contains good quality water, flowing from pastoral fields and woodland.
